intro: Achyronia pedicellata, commonly known as the pink sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Achyronia pedicellata is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in coastal dunes or desert scrub habitats.
